title: Use directly allocated native buffers in all gl-pointer calls, again
message:
Use directly allocated native buffers in all gl-pointer calls, again

This was done by reverting 5789a0b, resolving conflicts and manually
fixing the camera cube part.

Using direct buffers with native byte ordering became mandatory with
increasing targetSdkVersion to 4, otherwise we get

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Must use a native order direct Buffer

title: Revert "Use directly allocated native buffers in all gl-pointer calls"
message:
Revert "Use directly allocated native buffers in all gl-pointer calls"

This reverts commit 1f4150b02bfbd3d33bed9a06f89a38f83dd860b2. The directly
allocated buffers of native byte order turned out to be actually slower than
plain arrays, although they need to be converted at each pointer call!

Conflicts:

	TODO.txt
	src/com/rabenauge/parandroid/Scroller.java
	src/com/rabenauge/parandroid/StarField.java

title: Use point sprites instead of smoothed points for the blinking joints
message:
Use point sprites instead of smoothed points for the blinking joints

This is for greater compatibility. Some devices, like the Motorola Milestone,
do not support smoothed (anti-aliased) point rendering at all. Other devices,
like the HTC Hero, claim to support smoothed points of up to 32 pixels in
diameter but fail to render them properly.

title: Replace the logos with versions that only have a transparent background

Replace the logos with versions that only have a transparent background

foreground pixels was also proportionally converted to alpha, which resulted
in the logos looking to dark when blended in OpenGL.

Revert "PointSprite enable() should not toggle Texture2D enable()"

This reverts commit bb6ffc98aa0e72ada57d9040ecc4fb2ee4d23fbd as it was a
source of confusion that just calling enable() would not enable Point Sprites
if GL_TEXTURE_2D was previously disabled.
